data.text: @Snertly @NufocusfromBham Totally agree with expanding Medicaid....also want people to take responsibility for the aspects of their health that they can control with better habits/choices.....the two are not mutually exclusive.

@SavvyDee5 @NufocusfromBham Thanks for the typically knee jerk blame the victims reaction. Pretty sure you can't blame Alabama's high infant mortality rate on fast food. Expanding Medicaid would improve the lives of some 300,000 Alabamians for free if the ALGOP would simply accept what is offered.

@Snertly @NufocusfromBham Not a fan of the GOP, but all Alabamians have had their entire lives to give a damn about their own health and well-being....and most don't care enough to stop eating fast food & other crap and get some exercise.  Those two things alone would improve the health of 70%+ of adults.
@aldotcom As did poverty, lack of education, government mistrust and lack of resources outside of medicine. It’s a much BIGGER problem than just a lack of doctors.

@NufocusfromBham @aldotcom The @ALGOP has had ten years to give a damn about the health and well being of Alabamians, but they have not. Expand Medicaid today or confess that you hate most Alabamians and want to see them fall sick and die. Help or hurt, there is no middle choice. #ALpolitics
@aldotcom They were providing no treatment anyways

@aldotcom “the Black Belt saw some of the highest rates of vaccination in Alabama.”

I kind of feel like there’s a much, much bigger story being completely ignored to drive a narrative.
